attributes.action: Outlaw the choosing of Prime Ministers by party members who are not MPs
attributes.background: The choice of a new Prime Minister between general elections should not be delegated by elected MPs to unelected and unaccountable party members as if the office was a private possession of the party in power and those who have paid it a membership fee.

attributes.action: Secure the UK's membership of the European Single Market as soon as possible.
attributes.background: Following the result of the referendum on the UK's membership of the EU this petition calls on the new government to do everything within its means to secure the UK's membership of the Single Market as soon as possible. This will save jobs, economic growth and indirectly funding for public services.
attributes.additional_details: Recent turmoil in the financial markets and the precipitous decline in the value of sterling have demonstrated the importance of economic certainty and the UK's membership of the Single Market. The EU is the UK's most important trading partner. Securing tariff-free access to imports and exports of goods and services is critical to UK economic growth, jobs and public services.

attributes.action: Replace the current First Past The Post System with Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: The current system of FPTP is leaving Local Elections in England and Wales with abnormal results. parties are gaining a higher percentage of seats compared with the actual vote they receive, which is leaving the majority of voters unrepresented at Council level.
attributes.additional_details:
For example, in Castle Point, a party achieved 37% of the vote but gained 60% of the seats, while another party there achieved 31% of the vote but gains no seats.

In Oldham, 49.1% of the vote was enough to gain 75% of the seats available.

We are calling for a fairer system to be put in place so that every vote counts.

attributes.action: Remove Vat from sun creams of factor 30+ to reduce the incidence  skin cancers.
attributes.background: Expensive Sun tan creams discourage the use of this protection. The incidence of sun related skin cancers is rising as the strength of ultraviolet radiation increases. Act now to protect your and your children's skin from premature aging and the risk of developing potentially fatal skin cancers.
attributes.additional_details: Skin cancer.org

attributes.action: Impose mandatory custodial sentences for assaults on Emergency service personnel
attributes.background: To reduce assaults on emergency service personnel a strong deterrent must be in place. Anyone convicted of such an offence should receive a mandatory custodial prison sentence.
attributes.additional_details:
Emergency service personnel in this country work day in day out, 24 hours a day 365 days a year, putting themselves in life and death situations to help members of the public.

Far to often we see stories on the news of paramedics, police officers and fire fighters being subjected to countless assaults and sustaining injuries affecting their ability to work whilst also reducing the capacity of these services to continue to provide a full service to those who need it.

The only way to reduce this is to send a strong message that it WILL NOT be tolerated and to introduce a strong deterrent to anyone believing they can engage in such behaviour without serious consequences. As such anyone convicted of such a crime should be handed a mandatory custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Set up an independent commission to draft a new Representation of the People Act
attributes.background: Increasingly we are being asked to choose between extreme positions defined by the grassroots of both parties. Eg, holding a referendum without any predefined implementation plans means that, at this critical time in our history, the UK's future will be decided by 150,000 Conservative Party members.
attributes.additional_details: The old party models no longer correspond to the reality of 21st century society. We need a full reform of the electoral and parliamentary systems, possibly with some form of proportional or alternative voting system, and with a second house that could be selected across the whole of society by something akin to jury service. To decide what reforms are needed, an independent commission should be set up to propose a major overhaul of the system by means of a new Reform Act.

attributes.action: Pass the Restroom Acces Act (Ally's Law) in the UK
attributes.background: The Restroom Access Act  is an act that requires retail establishments that have toilet facilities for their employees to also allow customers to use the facilities only if the customer suffers from an inflammatory bowel disease or other medical condition requiring immediate access to a toilet.
attributes.additional_details: Inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD) can cause the sudden and sometimes painful urge to have a bowel movement — and this urge doesn’t always happen when a public restroom is available. This act means that people with IBD or other similar conditions will have to deal with far less discomfort and embarrassing moments due to not having urgent access to a restroom. A legislation already passed by many US states and has already proven to be a huge success.

attributes.action: A curriculum for the future. Give the youth a voice with in the education system
attributes.background:
We want a compulsory PHSE, that includes the following subjects :
•	Political, economics and current affairs. 
•	Wellbeing- basic life skills, mental health
•	Community cohesion & Cultural awareness-Justice, equality, discrimination
•	Finance, employment and enterprise
•	Social responsibility
attributes.additional_details:
Consultation with in schools and youth clubs in Manchester.
UKYP, National make your mark consultation- Curriculum for life coming in top 5 for 3 consecutive times.

attributes.action: Reopen the railway line between Calne and Chippenham
attributes.background: The branch line between Calne and Chippenham was closed in 1965, and with Calne constantly growing, and more and more people working in Chippenham (or elsewhere requiring further travel from Chippenham Station), a single carriage train running backwards and forwards seems a good idea.
attributes.additional_details: For more information on the old Railway line visit: http://www.railuk.info/lines/getline.php?id=1

attributes.action: Allow a Victim Surcharge Discretion when Sentencing Youths
attributes.background: Young people appearing in the Criminal Justice System, may be resident in Care Homes, from poor backgrounds or without the means to discharge the level of Victim Surcharge that MUST now be applied to every person when convicted.
attributes.additional_details: Effected through The Criminal Justice Act 2003 (Surcharge) Order 2012 (“the 2012 Order”), a court must order the Victim Surcharge when it deals with an offender in respect of an offence committed on or after 1 October 2012. Offenders under 18 years at the time the offence was committed must be ordered to pay between £10 and £20. The absolute position in Law, does not allow for any exercise of discretion by the Tribunal.

attributes.action: Abloish Road Tax Ved Tax for road Vehicles. Add2/2.5% to tax on petrol.
attributes.background: Currently there is a lot of debate about Vehicle excise duty. Whether there should be a 25 30 or 40 year rolling excemption. If the government added 2/2.5% on to the amount they take in tax form the cost of fuel, this would make the Treasury more money even short term. Fairer for all.
attributes.additional_details: The system I am proposing would be fairer to everyone in the whole country no mater what vehicle they own or drive. This would safe money as the DVLA wold not need to chase up or remind people to renew their Road Tax. The Government is always telling us we are all in this together and moving on. Well if we are all in this together and if we are moving on, this would simplify collecting Road Tax. The additional revenue could be ring fenced and put back into our road system and repair upgrade it.

attributes.action: Make compulsory all dogs in public spaces eg parks, footpaths etc to be on lead
attributes.background: The number of people, dogs and even farming livestock being attacked by dogs off lead is increasing. By making it compulsory for dogs to be on lead in public spaces at all times could reverse this trend. On the spot fines should be introduced.

attributes.action: Make it obligatory for teachers to hold Qualified Teaching Status
attributes.background: With the goal of all schools to be academies by 2020, by then there will be no general requirements for who can and cannot teach the children. This petition is to make it the law that teachers are qualified to at least degree level, with QTS before they are allowed to teach children.
attributes.additional_details: Children deserve to be educated by individuals who are competent. The value of university will be something of the past without the necessity to train.

attributes.action: Investigate the appalling service provided by Southern Rail during 2016
attributes.background: This year many trains have been cancelled by this company outside of industrial action. The company have cited staff shortages. But this is happening every day of every week. Surely their planning &/or HR department should & could have seen this coming.
attributes.additional_details: Only today two trains have been cancelled on the southern network. The 08:09 Southampton central & 08:30 Chichester. Many people rely on these services including school children who may be left venerable waiting on platforms when their parents are expecting them at a different time. This is a shocking service and needs to be resolved.

attributes.action: Allow Practice nurses employed prior to 6/3/1990 to retain Special Class Status
attributes.background: Because I became a practice nurse prior to 6/3/98 I have lost my right to retire without penalties at 55yrs, despite never having a break in my career. SCS nurses entering into General Practice after 6/3/1990 are entitled to retire at 55yrs, if they have not had a break of more than 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: Many nurses that have paid into the NHS pension scheme without a break of more than 5 years have the right to retire at the age of 55 years without penalty(this right was abolished for new nurses after 6/3/1995).  GP nurses were excluded from the pension scheme until 1/9/1997 so many have incurred a forced break of more than 5 yrs.(A period of time 6/3/95 - 31/8/97 is ignored) For those employed in GP work prior to 6/3/1990 the SCS has been removed and is unfair.

attributes.action: Stop the Children and Social Work Bill 2016
attributes.background: The government is trying to pass a bill that includes a section that would allow local councils to apply to be exempt from child protection laws. This is an appalling abuse of power and another attack on the rights of the most vulnerable in our society.
attributes.additional_details: www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/bills/lbill/2016-2017/0057/17057.pdf

attributes.action: When failing qts tests, Remove the 2 Year ban after failing tests 3 times
attributes.background: When future trainee teachers fail there qts tests 3 times, there is a two year ban for re-sitting the tests. However when a person fails there theory test 3 times, they do not get a two year ban. I suggest the ban be removed. The tests should be re-sat unlimited times, until passed.
attributes.additional_details: The tests will still need to be passed therefore the same high standard is set.

attributes.action: Allocate UK share of the EU science budget to UKRI for transnational research
attributes.background: Research & Innovation helps drive our economy.  Collaboration with international partners is essential to maintain the world-leading standard of UK research.  The UK has been one of the top beneficiaries from EU research and innovation framework funding programmes, enabling this activity.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaving the EU will jeopardise this support to quality and quantity of UK research.  The UK share of this fund should be protected for use for this purpose going forward.  Mechanisms most appropriate to the political situation will take time to clarify, yet the commitment to support this area of economic growth-driving should be made now.

http://tinyurl.com/jeyqy2k 
http://tinyurl.com/gwvo5u9 
http://tinyurl.com/zpop9n9

attributes.action: Give the local authority the power to direct academy schools to take a child.
attributes.background: Our 8 year old son with additional needs suffered sustained & violent bullying from a child over 4 years culminating in a significant mental health breakdown. The school can not & will not deal with the bullying. We now cannot get our son into a new school.
attributes.additional_details: Our son was removed from school to safeguard him as the school we were moving him to had conceded an appeal to take him meaning only out of school for 2 weeks, only for the new school to then rescind the offer, two further schools will now not accept him, all three sighting they require an educational health care plan to review first. No agency appears to be interested to grip this, EFA have sent it back to the local authority who have no authority over academies. 106 days out of education now.

attributes.action: Allow unaccompanied refugee children into the UK.
attributes.background:
According to Europol at least 10000 refugee children are missing. Europol  wans pan-European gangs are targeting minors for sex abuse and slavery.  
The adoption organisations Home for Good and Coram have somewhere between 9,000 and 10,000 families already offering to take unaccompanied minors.
attributes.additional_details:
The only restriction to these children being given one of these homes is current government policy. 
Let’s open the doors to the most vulnerable of children.

attributes.action: Hold a general Election in 2016 after the decision was made to leave the EU
attributes.background: The run up to the EU referendum has managed to prove that the Conservative government are not all of the same ideologies. In a time of vulnerability and Especially now the UK has to stand alone we need a Prime Minister that shows stability and integrity.

attributes.action: Legalise euthanasia for terminally ill patients.
attributes.background: Patients with life limiting conditions should be entitled to the option of euthanasia.
attributes.additional_details: Painful and drawn out deaths could be avoided if this option was made available. We should have the same rights as our pets.

attributes.action: Remove the 20% VAT that owners of sick pets are forced to pay.
attributes.background: I am a pet owner and live on a small income. My dog has helped me in lots of ways helped me through some tough times. I find 20% VAT on vet operations a rip off by this government for many pet owners and also many of those who are on small pensions.

attributes.action: Allow foreign nationals who are UK citizens of 3 yrs+ equal voting rights.
attributes.background: There are many foreign nationals living and working in the UK who have built businesses, set up families, own homes and who thus contribute to the UK economy in a way which should allow them a say regarding important decisions that affect them, such as the EU.

attributes.action: Proclaim a UK Bank Holiday to celebrate HM The Queen's 90th birthday year.
attributes.background: The Queen's official birthday will fall on Saturday 11th June in 2016, marking Her Majesty's 90th birthday. This is a wonderful moment for our nation and will be marked with public holidays around the Commonwealth and with the closure of British High Commissions and Embassies. The UK should join in!
attributes.additional_details: Around the world, Commonwealth nations and oversees UK territories will celebrate with public holidays on either Fri 10th June or Mon 13th June. This petition calls for the same opportunity for the United Kingdom at some point between June 2016 and June 2017, the 90th year of The Queen's life.

attributes.action: Create "Purple Badge"; short term "disability" mobility rights for those in need
attributes.background: People with long term disability can get a blue badge to park in disabled spaces close to buildings. It's hard to get blue badge and if only needed temporarily eg broken leg, after surgery/chemo where walking long distances is hard. Petition for temporary blue badge, given out by medics for set time
attributes.additional_details: When a patient is ill eg after surgery or chemo, getting out can help recovery. However it can be very daunting leaving the house and if you have to park on the opposite side of a large car park this often puts people off going outside. You often need someone with you to support you so getting dropped off and then meeting someone as they park the car is not an option too. There needs to be something for people to get the justified disabled car parking spaces whilst they need it, deemed by a dr

attributes.action: To make votes matter, adopt Proportional Representation for UK General Elections
attributes.background: The vast majority wants PR. Our FPTP voting system makes Parliament unrepresentative. One party got 37% of the vote and 51% of seats, while 3 parties got 24% of the vote but share 1.5% of seats. FPTP violates the democratic principle of majority rule and causes problems like costly policy reversals.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has never had a say on PR. As David Cameron himself said, the AV Referendum was on a system that is often less proportional than FPTP, so the rejection of AV could not possibly be a rejection of PR. In fact, so few voters wanted either system on offer that the turnout was just 42%.

There are tried and tested PR systems that keep the constituency link. They would make every vote matter equally, rather than allowing a minority of swing voters in a few marginal seats to pick the government.

attributes.action: Enforce disabled access in the UK rather than ignoring the issue
attributes.background:
Too many businesses in the UK do not have disabled access or even staff that are trained about the equality act and making reasonable adjustments.

Its time the UK took action to make disabled access mandatory in all businesses and for those who fail to be fined by their local authority.
attributes.additional_details:
Too many businesses in the UK do not have disabled access or even staff that are trained about the equality act and making reasonable 
adjustments for disabled people to have equal access to their services.

Its time councils had the power to issue fines, warnings and even court action against businesses that fail to comply with disability access law. Too little is being done to enforce this and a good number of disabled people do not have the energy to take these issues through court.

attributes.action: Improve the A21. Eliminate blindspots and place speed cameras along Kent street
attributes.background: There have been a number of fatalities along Kent street in 2016. One being on the 13 of August. Vast stretches of the a21 are seriously outdated and need improving. I'm asking that the government improve the a21 especially Kent street, by eke imitating blindspots and placing average speed cameras.
attributes.additional_details: There have been a number of letters to the government by residents of Kent street asking for changes, but nothing has been done. All the plans to improve the a21 have been shelved, and I'm asking that the government step in and change the road. 4 fatalities this year are evidence that something needs to be done.

attributes.action: Give work permits to illegal immigrants living in the UK for over 3 years.
attributes.background:
UK Government should give work permits to illegal immigrants who have been in the UK for over 3 years.
These illegal immigrants are from war torn or poverty stricken nations. To send them back to their countries is sending them to their deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
United Kingdom is a nation of compassionate, loving, hardworking, generous, hospitable and peaceful people.
Giving work permits to illegal immigrants who have been in the UK for over 3 years and have no criminal record will lead to:
1. Increase in UK's work force
2. Increase in UK's sources of income.
3. Added values to British rich cultures
4. Increase in UK's leading role as the most compassionate and generous nation on earth.

attributes.action: Putting signs on bridges and potential suicide spots offering support and hope.
attributes.background: Imagine feeling that there is no hope left in life, nothing to live for. These thoughts go through peoples heads daily and they consequently end their lives. Some people may have no one to talk to, but there are services that can help. I believe putting the information out there will save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics show that suicide is the biggest single killer of men under the age of 45. 
The idea of having signs has already been done in Japans Aokigahara Forest, where hundreds of people have gone to commit suicide. There are now signs which read  "Your life is something precious that was given to you by your parents" while another one states ''Do not be troubled alone." What i'm suggesting is signs with The Samaritans and other local mental health services details on to contact. There is help.

attributes.action: Fathers should automatically be granted 50% custody of their children by law
attributes.background: At present a father needs to fight to have 50% access to their child. A child that is legally a mother and fathers. A child needs a father just as much as a mother and the current legislation is not only stuck in the dark ages but favours considerably the mother. This needs to change.

attributes.action: REMOVE THE TRIDENT MISSILE SYSTEM AND ALL THE NUCLEAR SUBMARINES FROM SCOTLAND.
attributes.background: Trident is a WMD and the people of Scotland do not want it housed in their back gardens. We seek the urgent removal of this obscene weapon from Scottish waters.

attributes.action: To make sure all voulunteers on school trips are DBS/CRB checked
attributes.background: A primary school child, as young as 4 years can legally go on a school trip in a group of 6 children with one career. The career can be anyone connected to the school i.e parent, grandparent, a parents partner etc. The volunteers do not legally have to be DBS checked.
attributes.additional_details: A primary school child, as young as 4 years can legally go on a school trip in a group of 6 children with one career. The career can be anyone connected to the school i.e parent, grandparent, a parents partner etc. The volunteers do not legally have to be DBS checked. This means that the person caring for a child for the day could have anything on their criminal record and the school would not know about this.

attributes.action: The UK should negotiate with Australia to form a union between the two nations.
attributes.background:
If Scotland leaves the union England will be weaker on the world stage. The economy will fall, quality of life will plummet, etc. 
I propose a debate that involves the UK parliament to negotiate with the Australian parliament to form a union between the two.

attributes.action: Offer all new parents the chance to learn lifesaving baby CPR
attributes.background:
In an unresponsive child, the first few minutes of first aid that is administered can be the difference between life & death.
If parents were given the opportunity to learn lifesaving CPR skills, more infant deaths could be prevented.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently attended a first aid course. To see someone preform CPR on a small, lifeless baby (in this case it was just a training doll) hit me hard. I have three children. My youngest is just under a year old. And in an emergency, before that day, I wouldn't have known what to do. 
The skills I learnt that day made me realise all new parents should be offered basic training as part of the many after care checks taken by health professionals. One day, that parent may end up having to use it.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell tickets for more than 25% the face value!
attributes.background:
So today I tried to buy Red Hot Chilli Pepper tickets but at exactly 10am there were no tickets available. I was directed to ticketmasters sister site 'getmein' where the tickets were over 50% the original face value. 
We want to support the band, we do not want to support the touts!

attributes.action: Let the people of the UK decide if it should be split by Scotland's departure.
attributes.background: Scots had a referendum to decide if Scotland should be independent - and decided against. If they decide to try again there should be a referendum of the whole of the UK instead - the decision is bigger than just what Scotland wants - it is about what the UK wants and the future of our country.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to review how the Honours & Forfeiture Committees Operate
attributes.background: In light of the recent news relating to Philip Green & BHS, I call on the Government to review how the Honours and Forfeiture Committees operate and to consider changing the process for taking honours away.

attributes.action: Provide obese people with specialist help in their locality - it's their right
attributes.background: NHS guidelines say obese patients should have access to dedicated centres, staffed by experts in weight loss, exercise, and talking therapies, to help them reverse their weight gain prior to bariatric surgery. But this can be a postcode lottery.
attributes.additional_details: Obesity is often about much more than “just eat less”, otherwise millions of people would have just taken that advice. Guidelines recommend that prior to offering bariatric surgery (Tier 4) the NHS should provide help through dedicated centres staffed by experts in weight loss, exercise, and talking therapies, to help obese patients lose weight (Tier 3). This petition calls for more Tier 3 centres so all obese patients are able to access Tier 3 as a right.

attributes.action: Make publishing a false statement illegal
attributes.background: A publication that makes a factually incorrect statement – for whatever reason – and is proved to have done so, will have to publish a correction in the same prominence, location and size as the original false statement.
attributes.additional_details:
In a democracy, the key for debating and arguing ideas is a respect for the facts on which we base our opinions and views of the world. It’s the level playing field we must all respect. Opinions, predictions, and forecasts are quite different and would not be covered by such a law so long as they are clearly noted as such.  

This proposed law is not intended to cover persons as that is already covered by the law of slander and libel.

attributes.action: Legally require force food suppliers to label all halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.background:
I am not Muslim, i do not wish to eat halal meat, l do not agree with it religiously & ethically, i support animal rights.
I have accidentally eaten halal meat and this caused me religious and ethical issues and has deeply offended me, i demand ALL shops clearly label halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco- "we do not specify to suppliers whether halal practices should be followed"
M&S-  "we do not specify any religious practice as part of our sourcing policy so therefore do not label"

Sainsburys- "in NZ it is common for lamb to be blessed"

Morrisons- "all our lamb from NZ is pre-stunned and blessed"

Co-Op- "there is currently no UK wide labelling scheme"

ASDA- "No comment"

Waitrose- " there is currently no UK labelly scheme and we believe this is a matter where government should lead "

attributes.action: Abolish same roof rule and 1979 rule for historic sexual abuse victims
attributes.background: If you were abused by a family member living in the same household the Ministry of Justice thinks that's ok. If your abuse ended prior to October 1979 that's ok too. The CICA will not pay out any form of compensation if you fall into either of these categories, an unfair and unjust rule.
attributes.additional_details: My father and mother were recently jailed for what he did to me as a child I and my sisters were told to make a claim for compensation. We did but as my abuse ended in July 1979 and it was my father that sexually abused me the law says it was ok and I am entitled to nothing. This is not about the money this is about another slap in the face for abuse victims coming forward it needs to be changed.

attributes.action: To consider protecting CC41&11011 the historic symbols under IPO article 6_ter
attributes.background: I would like you to consider protecting the historic expired marks CC41 and 11011 under article 6_ter or equivalent Non EU regulation so that it remains free to use by the people and not that of sole property of an individual so that they are able to gain financial reward.
attributes.additional_details: It recently came to my attention that an individual has successfully published the iconic CC41, I intend to fully challange the Mark personally and have appealed and invited the millions of Brits to join me in this campaign,  so that the trademark CC41 is not granted solely to the individual Mr Douglas Steward, further information of this can be found on the IPO website under the words "CC41" The double 11s symbol 11011, another iconic symbol I also wish you to consider protecting.

attributes.action: Stop the temporary closure of brookside children and adolescent unit
attributes.background: As you may or not know brookside is temporary closing down and for so many young children and families that is devastation. The unit covers four boroughs and takes referrals from all over the country. There is a waiting list of kids in crisis for this unit and many who need help being discharged.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS are already inundated with referrals and are having to turn people away. Yet with the closure of brookside they are going to be under more pressure and local hospitals and crisis teams are going to be stretched out with the lack of hospital beds. There is no beds in the country whilst brookside is open how can this mental health system afford to loose 18 inpatient and 16 day patient beds.
Please do not let another child be a statistic because there was no safe place.

attributes.action: Introduce Government subsidies on public transport for full time students.
attributes.background: Studying in full time education can cost families a sufficient amount of money each year on transport to school and recreational activities which they may not have. This can cost families and students thousands of pounds every year which they can spend on other costs in the household like books.
attributes.additional_details: For a bus ticket from Seaton to Exeter it costs a student £10 for a return trip which the money can be used for a text book from school.Therefore  the government should subsidie public transport for students in full time education.

attributes.action: Unemployment and behaviour rehabilitation.  National service.
attributes.background:
1. Children/Adults on leaving school will be enrolled in a national service programme if they are not in employment or further education with 3 months of leaving school.

2. Young offenders 16-25 are entered into the national service programme for rehabilitation.
attributes.additional_details:
1a. They will recieve a set of skills and further education for a good platform in life and to be a working citizen.
1b. They recieve a wage which pays taxes back not benefits.
1c. Money taken and put into a fund for them when service is finished to help them with a start in life.

2a. Takes down over crowding in prisons.
2b. Gives them a set of skills and trade to give back something to community's. Something were they feel wanted.
2c. Reduces tax payers costs to prisoners.
2d. Pays taxes back.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a mother to deny contact with a child's father
attributes.background: Many mothers denying fathers having contact with there child for no reason what so ever! If the father is willing to step up and support there child, be there for them and care for them then why stop access?

attributes.action: The Government ignores the EU and starts to negotiate and sign trade deals now
attributes.background: Article 50 is intended to cause restrictions and harms the UK economy.  We need to sign new deals before the EU imposes a deal on us that requires the UK economy to start from scratch at the end of the 2 year period.  We need to start now to get deals as an incentive for the EU to give a good deal.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has always been fastidious in following the rules though they are often ignored by Germany and France.  We are leaving the EU and there is no longer a moral need to keep to these rules.  By not setting up new deals NOW we risk leaving the EU with only the deal that the EU wishes to give us.  We need to replace the trade with the EU with other trade pacts that will give the EU the incentive to give us a fair trade deal beneficial to both sides.

attributes.action: Amend the Harassment Act 1997 to stop criminalisation of those with disabilities
attributes.background: The clauses that were inserted into the amended version of the act has resulted in individuals that lack social understanding/capacity due to a disability being criminalised under this law reform. The act states that a person ‘ought to know their actions amounted to harassment of another’.
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals with these types of conditions lack social understanding. 
There needs to be an alternative to criminalising these individuals.

‘It costs £65,000 to process an individual through the criminal justice system.  According to the Focus Prisoner Education website, ‘prisoners with health conditions cost more on top of that standard figure to accommodate in prison’ (Focus Prisoner Education, 2015, http://www.fpe.org.uk).
